title: SEC-HIGH: Update pyasn1 to 0.6.2 - decoder DoS vulnerability
description: CVE-2026-23490: DoS via malformed RELATIVE-OID data causing memory exhaustion. Current: 0.6.1, Fix: 0.6.2

title: SEC-HIGH: Update azure-core to 1.38.0 - deserialization vulnerability
description: Deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability. Current: 1.36.0, Fix: 1.38.0

title: SEC-HIGH: Update aiohttp to 3.13.3 - multiple vulnerabilities (8 CVEs)
description: CVE-2025-69223: zip bomb DoS. Plus 7 other CVEs (smuggling, DoS, cookie parser). Current: 3.13.2, Fix: 3.13.3

title: SEC-HIGH: Update starlette to 0.49.1 - multiple DoS vulnerabilities
description: CVE-2025-62727: Range header O(n^2) DoS. CVE-2025-54121: multipart form DoS. Current: 0.46.2, Fix: 0.49.1

title: SEC-MOD: Update PyNaCl to 1.6.2 - libsodium incomplete disallowed inputs
description: CVE-2025-69277: libsodium crypto_core_ed25519_is_valid_point issue. Current: 1.6.1, Fix: 1.6.2

title: SEC-HIGH: Evaluate ecdsa Minerva timing attack - NO PATCH AVAILABLE
description: CVE-2024-23342: Minerva timing attack on P-256. Current: 0.19.1. NO OFFICIAL PATCH - project considers side-channel out of scope. Evaluate replacement or accept risk

title: SEC-MOD: Update fastapi-sso to 0.19.0 - CSRF OAuth vulnerability
description: CVE-2025-14546: CSRF through improper OAuth state parameter validation. Current: 0.16.0, Fix: 0.19.0

title: SEC-HIGH: Update python-multipart - arbitrary file write vulnerability
description: Arbitrary file write via non-default configuration. Current: 0.0.18, needs investigation for patched version

title: SEC-HIGH: Update urllib3 to 2.6.0 - decompression chain vulnerabilities
description: CVE-2025-66418, CVE-2025-66471: unbounded decompression chain, streaming API issues. Current: 2.5.0, Fix: 2.6.0

title: SEC-MOD: Verify orjson - recursion depth vulnerability (may be fixed)
description: CVE-2024-27454: unbounded recursion in orjson.loads. Current: 3.11.4, Fix: 3.9.15. LIKELY ALREADY FIXED - verify and close

title: SEC-MOD: Update filelock to 3.20.1 - TOCTOU symlink vulnerabilities
description: CVE-2025-68146: TOCTOU race condition allows symlink attacks during lock file creation. Current: 3.20.0, Fix: 3.20.1
